creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund

texts.textentryhtml: Created by Louis-Émile Durandelle, the artist. Acquired by François Lepage Collection, after 1889. Acquired by Millon, Paris; purchased at auction by Hans P. Krauer Jr. Fine Photographs, November 2022; purchased by Princeton University Art Museum, 2024.

geography.displaygeography: Place depicted: Europe, France, Île-de-France, Paris

caption: Louis-Émile Durandelle (1839–1917; born Verdun, France; died Bois-Colombes, France; active Paris, France), Perspective de la construction de la basilique du Sacré-Coeur, depuis le Boulevard des Batignolles (View of the construction of the Sacré-Coeur Basilica from the Boulevard des Batignolles), 1890. Albumen print; 33.7 × 43.5 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2024-101)
